faq.title: What is the Opportunity protocol?
faq.description: Opportunity is a decentralized protocol for permission-less labor markets where users can find work and earn money in the simplest manner.  Opportunity will be accessible through desktop and mobile clients at the end of its development.  The Opportunity protocol is enabled through a set of smart contracts deployed on the Ethereum blockchain.

faq.title: How is Opportunity different from other freelancing platforms?
faq.description: Opportunity is a user owned network of labor markets with immutable properties so user's don't experience the cons of central governance such as surprise fees and being deplatformed.

faq.title: What do you mean user's can deploy their own markets?
faq.description: User's can deploy their own labor markets on Opportunity and share  common data interface with the network.  These markets enable interoperability.  Examples include a decentralized uber or food delivery platform where user's want to instantly access past reivew data about worker on the network.

faq.title: What do you mean by Opportunity seeks to be simple?
faq.description: Labor markets on Opportunity require no KYC or unecessary onboarding documentation to start.  Simply connect a wallet and begin earning in a decentralized stablecoin such as DAI or any other enabled currencies.
